get.description: Retrieves a list of all contact channels for a user.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The ID of the user, or the special value `me` for the currently authenticated user

parameters.description: The ID of the user, or the special value `me` for the currently authenticated user

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user

id.description: The unique identifier of the contact channel

value.description: The value of the contact channel. For email, this should be a valid email address.

type.description: The type of the contact channel. Currently only "email" is supported.

used_for_auth.description: Whether the contact channel is used for authentication. If this is set to `true`, the user will be able to sign in with the contact channel with password or OTP.

is_verified.description: Whether the contact channel has been verified. If this is set to `true`, the contact channel has been verified to belong to the user.

is_primary.description: Whether the contact channel is the primary contact channel. If this is set to `true`, it will be used for authentication and notifications by default.

next_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the next page of results. null if there is no next page.

callback_url.description: The base callback URL to construct a verification link for the verification e-mail. A query parameter `code` with the verification code will be appended to it. The page should then make a request to the `/contact-channels/verify` endpoint.

post.description: This endpoint is used to exchange an authorization code or refresh token for an access token.

get.description: This endpoint is used to initiate the OAuth authorization flow. there are two purposes for this endpoint: 1. Authenticate a user with an OAuth provider. 2. Link an existing user with an OAuth provider.

code.description: A 45-character verification code. For magic links, this is the code found in the "code" URL query parameter. For OTP, this is formed by concatenating the 6-digit code entered by the user with the nonce (received during code creation)

refresh_token.description: Long-lived refresh token that can be used to obtain a new access token

access_token.description: Short-lived access token that can be used to authenticate the user

is_new_user.description: Whether the user is a new user

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user

post.description: Send a code to the user's email address for sign-in.

email.description: The email to sign in with.

callback_url.description: The base callback URL to construct the magic link from. A query parameter `code` with the verification code will be appended to it. The page should then make a request to the `/auth/otp/sign-in` endpoint.

nonce.description: A token that must be stored temporarily and provided when verifying the 6-digit code

post.description: Complete multi-factor authorization to sign in, with a TOTP and an MFA attempt code

refresh_token.description: Long-lived refresh token that can be used to obtain a new access token

access_token.description: Short-lived access token that can be used to authenticate the user

is_new_user.description: Whether the user is a new user

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user

post.description: Check if a sign in code is valid without using it

code.description: A 45-character verification code. For magic links, this is the code found in the "code" URL query parameter. For OTP, this is formed by concatenating the 6-digit code entered by the user with the nonce (received during code creation)

post.description: Update the password of the current user, requires the old password

post.summary: Sign up with email and password
post.description: Create a new account with email and password

email.description: The email to sign in with.

verification_callback_url.description: The base callback URL to construct a verification link for the verification e-mail. A query parameter `code` with the verification code will be appended to it. The page should then make a request to the `/contact-channels/verify` endpoint.

get.description: List team permissions of the current user. `user_id=me` must be set for client requests. Note that this might contain the permissions with the same permission ID across different teams. `(team_id, user_id, permission_id)` together uniquely identify a permission.

parameters.name: team_id

schema.description: Filter with the team ID. If set, only the permissions of the members in a specific team will be returned.

parameters.description: Filter with the team ID. If set, only the permissions of the members in a specific team will be returned.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: Filter with the user ID. If set, only the permissions this user has will be returned. Client request must set `user_id=me`

parameters.description: Filter with the user ID. If set, only the permissions this user has will be returned. Client request must set `user_id=me`

parameters.name: permission_id

schema.description: Filter with the permission ID. If set, only the permissions with this specific ID will be returned

parameters.description: Filter with the permission ID. If set, only the permissions with this specific ID will be returned

parameters.name: recursive

schema.description: Whether to list permissions recursively. If set to `false`, only the permission the users directly have will be listed. If set to `true` all the direct and indirect permissions will be listed.

parameters.description: Whether to list permissions recursively. If set to `false`, only the permission the users directly have will be listed. If set to `true` all the direct and indirect permissions will be listed.

id.description: The permission ID used to uniquely identify a permission. Can either be a custom permission with lowercase letters, numbers, `:`, and `_` characters, or one of the system permissions: `$update_team`, `$delete_team`, `$read_members`, `$remove_members`, `$invite_members`, `$manage_api_keys`

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user

team_id.description: The unique identifier of the team

next_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the next page of results. null if there is no next page.

get.description: List all the teams that the current user is a member of. `user_id=me` must be passed in the query parameters.

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: Filter for the teams that the user is a member of. Can be either `me` or an ID. Must be `me` in the client API

parameters.description: Filter for the teams that the user is a member of. Can be either `me` or an ID. Must be `me` in the client API

id.description: The unique identifier of the team

display_name.description: Human-readable team display name. This is not a unique identifier.

profile_image_url.description: URL of the profile image for team. Can be a Base64 encoded image. Must be smaller than 100KB. Please compress and crop to a square before passing in.

client_metadata.description: Client metadata. Used as a data store, accessible from the client side. Do not store information that should not be exposed to the client.

client_read_only_metadata.description: Client read-only, server-writable metadata. Used as a data store, accessible from the client side. Do not store information that should not be exposed to the client. The client can read this data, but cannot modify it. This is useful for things like subscription status.

next_cursor.description: The cursor to fetch the next page of results. null if there is no next page.

post.description: Create a new team and optionally add the current user as a member.

display_name.description: Human-readable team display name. This is not a unique identifier.

creator_user_id.description: The ID of the creator of the team. If not specified, the user will not be added to the team. Can be either "me" or the ID of the user. Only used on the client side.

profile_image_url.description: URL of the profile image for team. Can be a Base64 encoded image. Must be smaller than 100KB. Please compress and crop to a square before passing in.

client_metadata.description: Client metadata. Used as a data store, accessible from the client side. Do not store information that should not be exposed to the client.

client_read_only_metadata.description: Client read-only, server-writable metadata. Used as a data store, accessible from the client side. Do not store information that should not be exposed to the client. The client can read this data, but cannot modify it. This is useful for things like subscription status.

get.description: List team members profiles. You always need to specify a `team_id` that your are a member of on the client. You can always filter for your own profile by setting `me` as the `user_id` in the path parameters. If you want list all the profiles in a team, you need to have the `$read_members` permission in that team.

team_id.description: The unique identifier of the team

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user

display_name.description: Human-readable team member display name. This is not a unique identifier. Note that this is separate from the display_name of the user.

profile_image_url.description: URL of the profile image for team member. Can be a Base64 encoded image. Must be smaller than 100KB. Please compress and crop to a square before passing in.

post.summary: Send an email to invite a user to a team
post.description: The user receiving this email can join the team by clicking on the link in the email. If the user does not have an account yet, they will be prompted to create one.

team_id.description: The unique identifier of the team

email.description: The email of the user to invite.

callback_url.description: The base callback URL to construct an invite link with. A query parameter `code` with the verification code will be appended to it. The page should then make a request to the `/team-invitations/accept` endpoint.

post.description: Accept invitation and add user to the team

delete.summary: Remove a user from a team
delete.description: All the users are allowed to remove themselves from a team (`user_id=me`). Only the users who have the `$remove_members` permission are allowed to remove other users from a team. `team_id` is must an ID of a team that the user is a member of.
